title: These are the things that I like about Akali and think they should stay for the Assassin Update
body:
Season 3 Akali main here.  There are 4 things that I love about Akali and these are what they are.

**1) Having to proc Mark of the Assassin**
This makes the ability much more interesting than just a missile that you throw at your target for some damage.  Having it be like Annie's Q or Kayle's Q would just be boring because nothing goes on with the abilities outside of a lame stun or slow.  Having to actually get up and close to your enemies to do something makes it both more challenging and interesting to play with which makes the gameplay much less static and more fun.  She doesn't get damage off on her opponents for free like Annie or Kayle do with their Qs which is much less frustrating to play against and makes it so you can't just sit back and spam Q all day with nothing going on.  If you want to do that play a different champion.

**2) Twilight Shroud's Stealth**
This might be controversial because of all the stealth hate going on right now but whatever.  Twilight shroud has been one of the best things about playing Akali and I would be sad to see it go and be turned into a Graves smokescreen or whatever people are asking for.  Having it be countered by pinks and reveals makes it fair to play against unlike other champs like Twitch, Rengar, Eve, etc. because you know exactly where Akali is when she is stealthed and can take advantage of that.  At the same time, if the Akali player is smart, even if you have a reveal she can still take advantage of the movement speed it provides.  Being able to juke around your enemies is also really fun to do because of all the spots you can place it to give you multiple places to run to.  For example, something like this:
At 2:57
https://youtu.be/rrxUO_UpdmY?t=177

I also enjoy the idea of "Oh shit Akali is in her shroud better not fight her here" concept because it gives Akali more interesting ways of using Twilight Shroud's stealth to scare away her enemies or use it to position properly for an all in.

**3) Shadow Dance's 3 Charges and Resets**
To be quite frank, if Akali didn't have this part of her kit she would be complete garbage.  Being able to stick to your targets when they try to escape feels really good and enforces Akali's strength in being one of the best pick assassins in the game.  If she only had 1 ult charge then that would mean all of her damage would have to be through the roof in her Q and Ult which would just lead to 100-0 gameplay with just 1 combo.  Giving her 3 charges means that you can make her combo weaker in exchange for allowing her to do them more often than other Assassins.  Akali is known for being on the weaker burst side of the spectrum of Assassins and having multiple ult charges is why.  I like the reseting part of her ult because it still gives her something to do when she's killed her target.  Katarina can still bounce around all over the place after she's killed her target, leblanc can dash all over the place with her low cooldown W and still help the team with chain CC, Khazix has the slows on his W and the resets on his E for more jumping around, etc.  The reset aspect of Akali's ult is what allows her to still be useful to the team after she's finished off a carry instead of just sitting there doing basically nothing.

**4) Spellvamp**
Akali has no reliable defensive mechanism because her shroud is so easily countered with pinks and reveals and this is her way of staying alive in teamfights.  What I really like about this is that she doesn't get to press a button and get out scott free like other Assassins do, but in order to survive she is forced to fight.  If she doesn't fight then she doesn't get healed from her spellvamp and if she doesn't get healed from her spellvamp then she doesn't survive.  So this way she has to work to survive instead of just pressing a button and saying bye like Zed, Khazix, Leblanc, etc. can.  This can cause the problems of being a drain tank which can be really cancer to deal with and stuff but I'm sure Riot will either completely remove this from her or change it drastically.  I would just like it to be a part of her kit in some way or form instead of giving her a get out of jail free card because that would just emphasize hit and run fighting which isn't as fun as staying in the fray and fighting till the end.

Also, don't change the name of her Passive because that would just be sad.  This is an Akali thread so downvote away or whatever.  Thanks for reading.

Meh, she's an assassin that has very tricky escapes.  She has to R to a minion or use her shroud very well--if she didn't have spellvamp they'd have to give her more burst or a better escape, because she'd just get burst down herself before doing anything.
It's not as bad as when Zed/Talon were buying BT 24/7 and healing for their entire health in 3 autos so it is a moot point imho.
Just because zed and talon could do it, doesn't make it ok for akali to do it now.

To be honest, after Riki's Blink Strike rework, I am more in favour of reworking Akali entirely and get rid of her reliance on Shadow Dance as both a sticking and damage component. 

Being able to stick to a target multiple times WHILE dealing damage is much more powerful that it seems. While it is fun, and in fact absolutely necessary for Akali to function with her current kit, she probably needs a rework to not be dependent on this mechanic. Similarly, the Spellvamp probably requires a rework as well, one that is not stat based but perhaps combo-oriented. 

To be frank, Akali's kit needs a large-scale rework. Crescent Slash is underpar right now, while Shadow Dance is a very powerful ult that construct the basis of Akali's kit and playstyle. And Shadow Dance may not be the most healthy mechanism for an assassin. Her passive can probably be removed in favour of granting the passive bonus to ranks in her other abilities, in turn opening possibilities for another core gameplay of her kit.

Eh, Crescent Slash is definitely one of her best abilities right now and arguably the one thing with her Spell Vamp and Ult that even let her function as a champion. The ability to do hybrid damage and waveclear as early as level 5 (Rank 3 E with 2 long swords kills the entire wave with an auto to everything) make her no complete garbage and it is a much more reliable ability than Q which is a glorified 1 point wonder since they changed the energy refund. It is also the main reason bruiser Akali works since it scales well with AD and is spammable for how much damage it actually does (like a 240 base on a 0.8 second CD with a Total AD scaling).

Does it gel well with the rest of the kit? Arguably no, but it is one of her best abilities and she SHOULD keep the ability to do hybrid damage when they rework her since that is currently one of her best traits since only her and Corki are able to pull 50-50 damage splits fairly consistently (if you go bruiser akali you more often than not do a very close 50-50). The Q can honestly go since it is clunky in its current iteration and I would honestly like to see the playstyle of Bruiser Akali transition over to the rework than Glass Cannon Akali that just QR Autos you for most of your health. By taking the playstyle of Bruiser Akali that is more sustain damage based and AoE with mobility she would be the only AoE Assassin besides Talon and to some extent Katarina which would set her apart from the rest and it would arguably be healthier than the nightmare that was Akali during her prime where there was very little counterplay since she straight up 1 shot you with Q and R after Gunblade.

Diana is better to play against, because if you dodge her Q her damage is vastly reduced since she can't ult twice and uses mana, on top of avoiding the Q damage. Akali can RQAAER, no skillshots required and is undodge-able. She can artificially extend her range by ulting to a minion first as well. Although I'll say Diana isn't very fun to play against either.

Cutlass gives her slightly more Spell Vamp on top of the 10% Life Steal the item gives, so she can make an early back at 1500g and basically have her early weakness be negated.

But you're also forgetting that Akali will almost never get her full, perfect three rotations off. The ideal combo is Q, wait, R, AA, Q AA, three times, over a minimum of 12 seconds (no CD). If the ADC/team is good, you're not going to be able to get an initial Q off. If you have to use 2 R's to get to them, your damage is severely reduced from there. One incomplete rotation isn't enough to kill someone unless they're severely behind or went full glass canon (though a lot of ADC like to build some MR now). Dianas usually do well enough to RQWAA and get the kill. Maybe they throw another Q after if the first rotation didn't get the target.

4% extra spell vamp and 10% life steal when she has about 77 base AD (lvl 8). She might heal for 20s or 30s every Q + proc, but that's negated by an auto attack. Her weakness is pre-6, and she won't have full charges until at least level 7 (assuming no more than 5% CDR). Akali rarely goes cutlass over revolver.

The shroud needs to change.  Late game it is too easily countered.  Akali drops a shroud?  Your support or anyone else can drop a pink ward, 100% negating the shroud for the teamfight.  

Other stealth champions are not so severely countered by pinks.  Shaco,  for example, can play around a pink if he knows where it is.  The pink can effectively zone him, and can keep him from getting to juicy targets in a teamfight, but it does not completely erase his q.  

But with Akali, your shroud is  a big "place pink ward here" sign.  

I know you don't want Akali's kit to be changed.  But Akali is currently balanced around the fact that her shroud  is worthless late game (and her e is also pretty worthless since it cannot proc  q's and it is basically an energy hole in teamfights).  This means that Akali has to be given tons of damage on q and r, tons of mobility, and tons of spellvamp for her to be viable.  

Shroud needs to provide an advantage late game if the rest of her kit is going to be fixed.  However, you can't just make shroud immune to vision wards because this would make the shroud uncounterable.  

So the shroud needs to provide more conditional invisibility.  What needs to happen is that she is invisible to enemies outside the shroud when she is inside it and she is invisible to enemies inside the shroud when she is outside it.  You could make it so enemies must be inside the shroud for at least .25 or .5 seconds to gain vision of her, which would help her with ducking inside and outside the shroud.  You could fine tune it in other ways.  You could let it function as a blind, so enemies inside it cannot see outside it at all, which would give it a huge amount of power (including for Akali's who are behind, which would allow her to benefit her team even when behind, which in turn reduces her binary nature).  Combine this with two other changes: Akali  does not reveal herself by using spells if she would otherwise be invisible; and allow q's to stack, while reducing the damage for procing a single q but greatly increase the damage for procing multiple q's.  This allows her upfront damage to be nerfed, forcing her to play around her (very) strong shroud to stack q's and then delete an opponent.  For example, the damage on 1 q stack could be  fairly small while  the damage from procing three q's could be stratospheric, instantly deleting an adc with negatron cloak. This would do two things -- she wouldn't be able to instantly delete targets when snowballing.  However, with careful use of shroud and q stacks, she could still delete squishies even when behind.  

This would fix most of her problems -- she could provide utility and still assasinate when behind, assassination would require skillful use of shroud and setting up q stacks, and she would not snowball as hard.  This is a healthy assassin playstyle.  

I know you don't like this, but it is the only way to make the shroud meaningful late game while still allowing counterplay.
